de.frankfurt.uni.vcp.nodes.movables
Class Movable

java.lang.Object
  com.jme3.scene.Spatial
      com.jme3.scene.Node
          de.frankfurt.uni.vcp.nodes.movables.Movable
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.jme3.asset.Asset, com.jme3.collision.Collidable, com.jme3.export.Savable, Clickable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Camel, Carpet, Jinn, Roc, Rosa, Sphinx
public abstract class Movable
extends com.jme3.scene.Node
implements Clickable

Visual-Computing Praktikum - Aufgabe 2

Any node which has the capability to move within the game needs to subclass Movable. This class provides helper methods to follow a MotionPath.

Author:
Bernd Spï¿½th, Wladimir Spindler and Saman Sedighi Rad

Method Detail

setTarget

public void setTarget(Movable target)
As the features intercept and follow are currently not implemented at the moment this method has no effect.
Its inteded use is to set this movables target.

Parameters:
target - The target to intercept/follow

addWaypoint

public void addWaypoint(Field field)
Add a new waypoint to this movables planned movement.
A shortest path from either the last waypoint given, or the actual location of this movable if no previous waypoint exists will be calculated.
All fields on this path will be added to this movables way planning.

Parameters:
field -

undo

public void undo()
Remove the last waypoint from this movables way planning
This will also remove any fields lying on the route between this and the previously added waypoint.

undoAll

public void undoAll()
Undos all steps at once.

redo

public void redo()
Add the last waypoint previously removed to this movables way planning

public void highlightPath()
Highlight the fields lying on the path of this movables way planning

getReachableFields

public java.util.LinkedList<Field> getReachableFields(int k)
Determines the nodes that are reachable from a given radius around the movables current field position.

Parameters:
k - Field radius.
Returns:
List of readable fields within the given radius.

onClick

public void onClick(java.lang.String name)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    StatusError,
                    ProtocolError
Depending on the action associated with this mouse-click either select this unit, attack this unit, initiate trade with it, or even follow it.
Note: Neither trade nor follow are currently implemented.

Specified by:
onClick in interface Clickable
Parameters:
name - name of the action, that was triggered by the mous-click
Throws:
java.io.IOException
StatusError
ProtocolError
